item.title: Last Played For India 8 Years Ago, Batter With Average Of 664, Back In Selection Fray: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Karun Nair's Remarkable Return to India's Test Selection Fray

Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

After nearly eight years since his last match for India, Karun Nair has turned his cricketing career around impressively and is reportedly in the fray for national selection again following exceptional performances in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • Nair scored an incredible 303 against England but fell out of India's plans for Test cricket.
  • He has remained unbeaten across six innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, with scores exceeding 600 runs.
  • Nair is among the few players to have five centuries in a single tournament edition.
  • His resurgence comes during a transitional phase for the Indian Test team, particularly with the nearing retirements of senior players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
“Dear cricket, give me one more chance.” — Karun Nair

Despite his struggles, Nair's determination and hard work have reignited his hopes for selection, thus highlighting the cyclical nature of sports careers.

item.title: Michelsen upsets Tsitsipas at Australian Open - ATP Tour
item.description:
Alex Michelsen Upsets Stefanos Tsitsipas at Australian Open

Date: January 13, 2025
Source: ATP Tour

Alex Michelsen produced a major upset by defeating 2023 finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas in a four-set match, marking his first win against a Top 20 player at a Grand Slam.

  • Michelsen won the match with scores of 7-5, 3-6, 6-2, 6-4.
  • The match included 46 winners from Michelsen, including eight aces.
  • Despite some drama in the fourth set with double faults, a crucial double fault from Tsitsipas at 5-all secured the win for Michelsen.
  • The victory propels Michelsen to a career-high No. 41 in the ATP rankings.
  • Michelsen is now 2-0 against Tsitsipas in their head-to-head encounters.
“I tried to stay super composed; I knew it would be a battle and I’m super happy to get through,” said Michelsen.

This win highlights Michelsen's potential as he progresses to face either Martin Landaluce or James McCabe in the next round.

item.title: IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25 - The Times of India
item.description:
IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: Times of India

The 18th season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) will kick off on March 21 at Kolkata’s Eden Gardens, with the final set for May 25. This change comes after the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) adjusted the schedule from earlier proposed dates.

  • The IPL season will start a week later than initially announced.
  • Kolkata Knight Riders will host both the opener and the final at Eden Gardens.
  • The schedule change is reportedly due to broadcaster preferences to avoid overlap with the Champions Trophy.
  • The BCCI is expected to release the complete schedule shortly.
“The Indian squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy will likely be announced on January 19.”

This adjustment in schedule shows the influence of international cricket events on domestic leagues, highlighting the need for careful planning by the BCCI.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah set to lose to Rishabh Pant or Yashasvi Jaiswal in Test captaincy race - Crictoday
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's Captaincy Future in Doubt as Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal Emerge as Contenders

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

After leading India in the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy is in jeopardy due to ongoing fitness issues. With his future uncertain, Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal are emerging as potential candidates for the vice-captaincy.

  • Bumrah led India in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, but the team lost 1-3.
  • Concerns about his back spasms may hinder his participation in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.
  • The national selectors are contemplating a new vice-captain with Rohit Sharma nearing the end of his career.
  • Bumrah was recently injured during a match and will undergo rehabilitation in Bengaluru.
  • Selectors are preparing a Plan B in case Bumrah's fitness does not improve.
“While the selectors and team management are waiting for Bumrah’s recovery, the uncertainty around his fitness continues to raise doubts about his future as the team’s leader.”

The situation surrounding Bumrah's fitness highlights the challenges ahead for Indian cricket as they plan for the upcoming series and tournaments.

item.title: Cummins, Hazlewood included for Champions Trophy - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Cummins and Hazlewood Named in Australia's Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: February 10, 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have been included in Australia's squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy, with Cummins set to captain the team despite ongoing concerns about his ankle injury and Hazlewood's recovery from a calf injury.

The Australian squad includes a blend of experienced and younger players. Key details are highlighted below:

  • Pat Cummins is on paternity leave but remains captain for the Champions Trophy.
  • Josh Hazlewood is expected to recover in time from his calf injury.
  • Nathan Ellis has been selected as the fourth pace bowler.
  • Australia's first ODI against Sri Lanka is scheduled for February 13.
  • The squad features a mix of experienced players involved in previous international tournaments.
“This is a balanced and experienced squad with the core having been involved in the previous one-day World Cup,” said George Bailey, chair of selectors.

Australia's Champions Trophy begins with group matches against England, South Africa, and Afghanistan, leading up to the semi-finals and final in March.

item.title: Karun Nair on selectors' radar amid India's Kohli-Rohit situation after fourth straight century in Vijay Hazare Trophy - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Karun Nair scored 664 runs in Vijay Hazare Trophy without being dismissed

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Karun Nair is back on the selectors' radar after an impressive run in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, scoring 664 runs without being dismissed. He has hit four consecutive centuries and is being considered for national selection.

  • Nair scored 664 runs in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, remaining unbeaten throughout.
  • He achieved four consecutive centuries, including an unbeaten score of 122 in the quarterfinals.
  • This performance marks the most runs scored in List A cricket without being dismissed.
  • Nair expressed his determination to return to the national team and has worked hard to secure his place.
“Everyone wants to play for their country and I’m no different. I would love to play Test matches again.”

Nair's excellent performance has drawn attention amid India's changing team dynamics, particularly with senior players struggling.

item.title: Huge Pat Cummins Surprise As Australia Announce ICC Champions Trophy Squad - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Huge Pat Cummins Surprise As Australia Announce ICC Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Australia has announced their squad for the ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan, welcoming back captain Pat Cummins and injured paceman Josh Hazlewood. Cummins missed the Sri Lanka Test tour for the birth of his second child and is dealing with a knee injury.

  • Pat Cummins returns as captain after skipping the Sri Lanka Test tour.
  • Josh Hazlewood is included despite recent injuries.
  • Jake Fraser-McGurk was dropped due to poor form.
  • The squad combines experience from previous tournaments and recent series.
  • The Champions Trophy will take place in Pakistan and the UAE from February 19 to March 9.
AUSTRALIA SQUAD FOR CHAMPIONS TROPHY 2025:
Cummins (C), Carey, Ellis, Hardie, Hazlewood, Head, Inglis, Labuschagne, Marsh, Maxwell, Short, Smith, Starc, Stoinis, Zampa.

This squad reflects a strategic selection aiming for a balanced and competitive team in the upcoming tournament.

item.title: Yograj Singh Makes Massive U-Turn On MS Dhoni, Says "Best Thing About..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Yograj Singh Makes Massive U-Turn On MS Dhoni, Says "Best Thing About..."

Publication Date: October 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Yograj Singh, father of cricketer Yuvraj Singh, has changed his perspective on MS Dhoni, previously criticizing him for impacting his son's career. In a recent interview, he praised Dhoni for his motivational leadership and fearless playing style.

  • Yograj Singh has softened his criticism of MS Dhoni.
  • He highlighted Dhoni's tactical intelligence and ability to inspire players.
  • Yograj referenced a memorable moment where Dhoni faced a bouncer without flinching.
  • Former cricketers have defended current players against recent critiques after a series defeat in Australia.
“What I liked the most about him was that he was a fearless man... There are very few people like him.” - Yograj Singh

This shift in Yograj Singh’s opinion reflects a broader discourse in cricket, where public scrutiny of players is intensified by social media.

item.title: "Even If Yuvraj Singh Had Died As India Won World Cup, I Would've Been Proud": Father Yograj Singh - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Even If Yuvraj Singh Had Died As India Won World Cup, I Would've Been Proud: Father Yograj Singh

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Yograj Singh expressed immense pride in his son Yuvraj Singh's contributions to Indian cricket, emphasizing his commitment and achievements despite a battle with cancer.

  • Yuvraj Singh was instrumental in India's 2011 World Cup victory and was named Player of the Series.
  • He was diagnosed with cancer after the World Cup, which impacted his cricketing career thereafter.
  • Yograj revealed in a podcast that he would have been proud even if Yuvraj had died winning the World Cup.
  • He believes Yuvraj did not fully realize his potential as a cricketer.
  • In 2011, Yuvraj scored 362 runs in the tournament, showcasing his exceptional talent.
“For our country, if Yuvraj Singh had died from cancer and had won India the World Cup, I would have been a proud father. I still am very proud of him.” - Yograj Singh

The father’s admiration for his son highlights the legacy Yuvraj Singh left in Indian cricket, despite facing personal challenges.

item.title: Kohli ‘didn’t like' Rayudu: Ex-India star drops bombshell rant on controversial 2019 World Cup snub, reveals ‘he had…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kohli ‘didn’t like' Rayudu: Ex-India star drops bombshell rant on controversial 2019 World Cup snub, reveals ‘he had…’

Date: Jan 13, 2025 06:21 AM IST Source: Hindustan Times

A former India cricketer recalled Ambati Rayudu’s controversial 2019 World Cup snub and blamed it on ex-captain Virat Kohli.

  • The 2019 ODI World Cup saw India crash out in the semi-finals against New Zealand.
  • Ambati Rayudu, a fan favorite, was left out of the World Cup squad, causing significant controversy.
  • Robin Uthappa claims Kohli's personal preferences led to Rayudu's exclusion from the team.
  • Kohli's treatment of other players, including Yuvraj Singh after his cancer recovery, was also criticized.
  • Rayudu publicly expressed his disappointment and mentioned a lack of support from the selection committee.
“If he (Virat Kohli) didn't like anyone, he didn't feel someone is good, then they were cut. (Ambati) Rayudu is the prime example.” - Robin Uthappa

This revelation sheds light on the internal dynamics within Team India during the World Cup, highlighting the impact of personal preferences on team selections.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's injuries likely to be roadblock for Test captaincy, surprise name joins race to succeed Rohit: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's injuries likely to be roadblock for Test captaincy, surprise name joins race to succeed Rohit: Report

Date: Jan 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Jasprit Bumrah's persistent injury issues may undermine his chances of becoming the next Test captain of India, as selectors weigh his candidacy over concerns of his fitness.

  • The BCCI is contemplating moving on from current captain Rohit Sharma.
  • Bumrah's recent back spasms have raised doubts regarding his availability for the Champions Trophy.
  • Selectors are considering Rishabh Pant and Yashasvi Jaiswal for the vice-captaincy role.
  • Bumrah has been a key player in the Indian pace attack but faces fitness challenges as he ages.
“The crux of the issue is Bumrah’s fitness and workload management.”

With Bumrah's health in question, the selectors may need to prepare for alternative leadership options moving forward.

item.title: Three observations as Bayern Munich scrape past Borussia Mönchengladbach 1-0 - Bavarian Football Works
item.description:
Bayern Munich Narrowly Defeats Borussia Mönchengladbach with a 1-0 Victory

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Bavarian Football Works

Bayern Munich just barely beat Borussia Mönchengladbach as the Bundesliga finally returned to action this weekend, thanks to a Harry Kane penalty. The victory marked an important three points, maintaining a four-point lead over Bayer Leverkusen.

  • Bayern struggled to convert clear chances, missing multiple opportunities to extend their lead.
  • Alphonso Davies and Joshua Kimmich stood out as key players, both requiring contract extensions soon.
  • Gladbach's backup keeper Moritz Nicolas had an exceptional performance, keeping scores limited.
“The attack looks pathetic without Jamal Musiala and frankly, there is not much he could have done.”

Fans hope for improved performance and results from Bayern in upcoming matches as they continue their Bundesliga campaign.

item.title: Devajit Saikia Elected New BCCI Secretary, Replaces Jay Shah - News18
item.description:
Devajit Saikia Elected New BCCI Secretary, Replaces Jay Shah

Date: January 12, 2025, Source: News18

Devajit Saikia was elected unopposed as the new BCCI Secretary at a Special General Meeting in Mumbai, succeeding Jay Shah, who vacated the position after becoming ICC Chairman.

  • Devajit Saikia and Prabhtej Singh Bhatia were elected unopposed for the positions of Secretary and Treasurer, respectively.
  • Both candidates were the only ones to file nominations for the vacant posts.
  • Jay Shah left his position after his election as ICC Chairman last month.
  • Saikia had been performing the duties of Secretary in the interim.
  • The election was uncontested, eliminating the need for a polling process.
“The Two (02) Elective Posts of the Office Bearers – Secretary and Treasurer were Uncontested, and it was not necessary to conduct a Poll in respect of these Two (02) Posts,” stated electoral officer A K Joti.

In conclusion, Devajit Saikia’s election is a continuation of stable leadership in the BCCI following the recent changes in the organization's hierarchy.

item.title: Arsenal's week from hell leaves Mikel Arteta feeling the heat: Winners and losers as Gunners suffer FA Cup penalty heartbreak while Ruben Amorim's Man Utd again show improvements with Altay Bayindir the hero - Goal.com
item.description:
Arsenal's week from hell leaves Mikel Arteta feeling the heat

Publication Date: Not specified Source: GOAL

The most enticing tie of the FA Cup third round saw Arsenal suffer a heartbreaking penalty shootout defeat to Manchester United, raising concerns for Mikel Arteta as his team edges closer to another trophy-less season.

  • Manchester United edged past Arsenal after a dramatic 120 minutes of play.
  • United's goalkeeper Altay Bayindir was pivotal, saving a crucial penalty and performing strongly throughout the match.
  • Arsenal's Kai Havertz missed a penalty, highlighting the team's pressing need for a striker.
  • Mikel Arteta faces mounting pressure with his team's recent disappointing performance.
“Diogo Dalot must be hugely grateful to Altay Bayindir...”

The match not only affected the tournament standings but also cast doubt on Arsenal's season ambitions, as they seek to avoid a continuous cycle of disappointing results.

item.title: Real Madrid vs Barcelona LIVE Score, Spanish Super Cup 2025 Final: Alejandro Balde Scores | Real Madrid 1-4 Barcelona - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Real Madrid vs Barcelona LIVE Updates, Spanish Super Cup 2025 Final

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: NDTV Sports

In a thrilling Spanish Super Cup final, Barcelona emerged victorious against Real Madrid with a stunning 5-2 win, showcasing their dominance in El Clasico.

  • Barcelona played with ten men but managed to secure a convincing victory.
  • This match marks a significant achievement for Barcelona in the 2025 season.
  • Real Madrid struggled to capitalize on their chances despite a strong start.
“This victory is a testament to our resilience and teamwork,” said Barcelona's manager after the match.

Barcelona's performance not only secures them the Super Cup title but also boosts their confidence moving forward in the season.

item.title: Kai Havertz branded 'the worst signing in Arsenal's history' after 'abysmal' FA Cup display vs Man Utd as Mikel Arteta is warned that their 'season is OVER' if he doesn't bring in a new striker this month - GOAL English
item.description:
Kai Havertz branded 'the worst signing in Arsenal's history' after 'abysmal' FA Cup display vs Man Utd

Publication Date: January 2023
Source: Goal.com

The article discusses the backlash faced by Arsenal's Kai Havertz following his poor performance in the FA Cup match against Manchester United, with fans and pundits expressing concerns over his contributions to the team.

  • Kai Havertz labeled as a poor signing for Arsenal.
  • His performance in the FA Cup described as 'abysmal.'
  • Warning issued to Mikel Arteta regarding the need for a new striker.
  • The phrase 'the season is OVER' if no changes are made is highlighted.
“If we don’t bring in a new striker this month, our season is OVER.”

The criticism of Havertz raises questions about his future at the club and the strategies of Mikel Arteta moving forward.

Real Madrid vs Barcelona Live Streaming Supercopa De Espana Final Live Telecast: When And Where To Watch

Publication Date: N/A Source: NDTV

Get all the details on how to watch the much-anticipated Supercopa De Espana final between Real Madrid and Barcelona live.

  • Live streaming options for the final are available.
  • Details on timings and broadcasting channels.
  • Preview of the match and team lineups anticipated.
“Both teams have been in good form leading up to this exciting clash.”

This match is highly anticipated by fans in Spain and around the world as both teams vie for glory.

item.title: Real Madrid vs Barcelona Live Streaming Supercopa De Espana Final Live Telecast: When And Where To Watch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Real Madrid vs Barcelona Live Streaming Supercopa De Espana Final Live Telecast: When And Where To Watch

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: NDTV

The Supercopa de Espana final is set for an exciting clash between FC Barcelona and Real Madrid, marking the third consecutive year these teams face off in this prestigious tournament.

  • Barcelona defeated Athletic Bilbao 2-0 to reach the final.
  • Real Madrid bested Mallorca 3-0 in their semi-final matchup.
  • The match will take place on January 13, 2025, at King Abdullah Sport City, Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.
  • Kick-off is scheduled for 12:30 AM IST on Monday.
  • No live television broadcast in India; streaming available on the FanCode app and website.

(All details are as per information provided by the broadcaster)

Fans eagerly anticipate this El Clasico showdown, with both teams vying for this significant trophy in the Spanish football calendar.

item.title: Real Madrid vs Barcelona Live streaming: 2025 Supercopa de Espana Final Live TV telecast, channel, time - myKhel
item.description:
Real Madrid vs Barcelona Live streaming: 2025 Supercopa de Espana Final Live TV telecast, channel, time

Published: Sunday, January 12, 2025, 23:30 [IST]

Real Madrid and Barcelona will face off in the Spanish Super Cup final at King Abdullah Sports City on Sunday late night. Los Blancos, fresh from a 3-0 semi-final win over Mallorca, seek their third trophy this season. La Blaugrana, aiming for their 15th Super Cup, defeated Athletic Bilbao 2-0 in their semi-final. Real Madrid holds a five-game winning streak, while Barcelona's recent form has dipped in La Liga.

Real Madrid vs Barcelona Match Details

  • Date: Monday, January 13, 2025
  • Time: 12:30 IST / 7:00 PM BST
  • Venue: King Abdullah Sports City, Jeddah, Saudi Arabia

Real Madrid vs Barcelona Live Streaming Details:

United Kingdom: Online Streaming: The UK viewers can watch the match through TNT Sports network from 7:00 PM BST.

United States: Online Streaming: The match will be telecast on ESPN and ESPN+ channel in the USA at 2:00 PM ET.

India: Online Streaming: The match will be streamed on FanCode website and app starting at 12:30 AM IST on January 13.

Nigeria: Online Streaming: The match will be telecast on the StarTimes network from 8:00 PM Nigeria time.

Indonesia: Online Streaming: The match will be live streamed on RCTI, iNews, MNC, and Sportstars networks from 2:00 AM Indonesia time.

Australia: Online Streaming: The match will begin from 6:00 AM Australia time on Monday.

UAE & Saudi Arabia: Online Streaming: The match will be shown live on Shahid sports network at 11:00 PM local time in UAE.

Pakistan: Online Streaming: The match will begin from 12:00 AM Pakistan time.

Bangladesh: Online Streaming: The match will begin from 1:00 AM Bangladesh time.

Nepal: Online Streaming: The match will begin from 12:45 AM Nepal time.
